etymologies: early 17th century: French, blend of savate ‘shoe’ and botte ‘boot’

definitions: a kind of simple shoe, shaped and hollowed out from a single block of wood, traditionally worn by French and Breton peasants.
shortDefinitions: kind of simple shoe, shaped and hollowed out from single block of wood

definitions: a device which ensures the correct positioning of a bullet or shell in the barrel of a gun, attached either to the projectile or inside the barrel and falling away as it leaves the muzzle.
shortDefinitions: device which ensures correct positioning of bullet or shell in barrel of gun

definitions: a box from which cards are dealt at casinos in gambling games such as baccarat and chemin de fer.
shortDefinitions: box from which cards are dealt at casinos
